text: Margaret Grundy (born 1938), is a female former swimmer who competed for England. ==Swimming career== She represented England and won a bronze medal in the 220 yards breaststroke at the 1954 British Empire and Commonwealth Games in Vancouver, Canada. At the ASA National British Championships she won the 220 yards breaststroke title in 1943 and 1954. She was coached by Lucy Morton. ==References== Category:1938 births Category:English female swimmers Category:Commonwealth Games medallists in swimming Category:Commonwealth Games bronze medallists for England Category:Living people Category:Swimmers at the 1954 British Empire and Commonwealth Games
title: Margaret Grundy
